item.title: Nintendo Music Adds Fire Emblem: Awakening Soundtrack In New Update
item.content:encoded:
Switch Online icons also available

Apart from a Switch and Switch 2 firmware update today, Nintendo has also released its weekly Nintendo Music update.

The latest update adds the soundtrack from the 2012 3DS tactical RPG, Fire Emblem: Awakening. You can get a quick sample of this album in the official Nintendo social post below:

To access this soundtrack on the Nintendo Music app, you'll need to have an active Switch Online subscription. Some other Fire Emblem albums on this service include Fire Emblem Engage and Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade.

Nintendo has also added Fire Emblem icons to Switch Online this week, which you require to play Fire Emblem on the Game Boy Advance app to unlock (some F-Zero icons have also been added).

What do you think about the latest Nintendo Music update? Have you played Fire Emblem: Awakening? Let us know in the comments.

item.title: More Mega Evolution Pokémon Are Coming To Pokémon Unite
item.content:encoded:
Starting with Mega Lucario this October

It's been announced the free-to-play Switch and mobile MOBA Pokémon Unite will be getting "more Mega Evolution Pokémon" soon.

Mega Lucario will join the fray on 3rd October 2025, and this Pokémon will be followed by Mega Charizard X on 24th October 2025. After this, there'll be two more Mega Evolution surprises before the end of the year. When we find out who they are, we'll let you know.

"Even more Mega Evolution Pokémon are coming to #PokemonUNITE soon! Mega Lucario will join the fray on October 3, and Mega Charizard X will follow on October 24. Plus, two more Mega Evolution Pokémon will arrive on Aeos Island by the end of 2025!"

Ahead of these Pokémon, there's also Pawmot (4th September 2025) as well as others like Empoleon (19th September 2025), Dhelmise and Vaporeon joining the game's roster. The legendary Groundon will also be appearing in Theia Sky Ruins map from 4th September 2025.

Have you played this game? What other Megas would you like to see? Let us know in the comments.

item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 System Update 20.4.0 Is Now Live, Here Are The Full Patch Notes
item.content:encoded:
Available for Switch, too

We're now in September, and Nintendo has rolled out a new firmware update for the Switch 2 and original Switch.

It's seemingly a small one, with the patch notes mentioning how it has improved the overall "stability". Here are the full patch notes, courtesy of Nintendo's official support page.

Version 20.4.0 (Released September 1st, 2025)

"General system stability improvements to enhance the user's experience."

According to dataminer 'OatmealDome', there have been some small adjustments on the original Switch as well. Here's the rundown:

"Version 20.4.0 was released. The patch notes lists "stability" as the sole change. On Switch 1, the controller-handling code and the web browser were updated."

If we hear anything else about what's included in this latest update, or if there are any backward compatibility fixes, we'll let you know. Nintendo has already improved multiple Switch games on the Switch 2.

Have you downloaded this latest firmware update yet? Let us know in the comments.

item.title: Ubisoft Kicks Off Rayman's 30th Anniversary, Says New Project Is In "Good Hands"
item.content:encoded:
Just don't expect news "too soon"

Ubisoft's famous mascot Rayman is celebrating 30 years, and as part of this, the third-party giant has all sorts of plans.

Apart from reflecting on the character's career – including behind-the-scenes information, anecdotes, developer interviews, concept art and "more" over the next month, as you might recall, the team at Ubisoft Montpellier and Ubisoft Milan are currently working on the next major Rayman project.

Ubisoft Brand Producer Loïc Gounon reconfirmed this, mentioning how "Rayman is in good hands" but don't expect news about the new project "too soon".

This follows a previous update in May, which confirmed at the time Ubisoft was pushing ahead with plans to revive the Rayman brand, after the discovery of new job adverts. Ubisoft originally shared a statement about Rayman's return in October last year.

Apart from this update, Rayman composer and music advisor Christophe Heral, who worked on Rayman Origins and Rayman Legends, also featured in this latest video update to share a song.

The original 2D Rayman platformer debuted in 1995 and was eventually released on devices like the Game Boy Color and Game Boy Advance. A 3D sequel followed during the Nintendo 64 generation, and the rest is history.

What would you like to see from Rayman's next adventure? Let us know in the comments.

item.title: Poll: What Review Score Would You Give 'Kirby & The Forgotten Land + Star-Crossed World'?
item.content:encoded:
Ludicrously long titles are so hot right now

Kirby landed on Nintendo's latest console last week, a few months ahead of his upcoming Switch 2 exclusive Kirby Air Riders in November.

The updated version of Kirby and the Forgotten Land followed on from the snazzy Nintendo Switch 2 Edition of a Switch 1 game released in July, the (similarly) laboriously titled Super Mario Party Jamboree - Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Jamboree TV, adding some bespoke new stuff into the brilliant base game along with the resolution and frame rate upgrades you'd expect.

PJ gave Star-Crossed World a sparkling 9/10 in his review. It's perhaps Kirby's finest game, now even bigger and better. What's not to like? Besides the $80 price tag, of course. It's sitting on a "Generally Favorable" Metascore of 83 as of today, so it seems it's doing something right.

Have you picked up the upgrade? Or have you, like one Jim Norman of Nintendo Life, jumped into the Forgotten Land for the first time on Switch 2? We're keen to hear what score you'd award this latest NS2 Edition. Remember, if you haven't played it yet, you can return at any time and score the game from 1-10 as you see fit, or adjust your score if you change your mind.

Oh, and if you've already rated Kirby and the Forgotten Land - Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Star-Crossed World (wheeze) in our database, thank you! Your score already counts in the poll below, so no need to duplicate it.
